I think that a ton of people want villager knights because iron golems seem like the kind of thing that would be in a stronghold

So an Iron Golem Pillager that looks like a villager in armour? Like that. Also like the idea that they would be the same size as a villager so they can't climb up onto a roof or get stuck in a fenced off area because of their size. That is so annoying when you find an entire village has been wiped out and a Golem is just standing there, stuck on a roof or in a yard, just watching the massacre. Or when they yeet some poor bad guy or unlucky villager into a crop and mash the plant and soil flat. It's almost like they don't think about the consequences.

Smart idea, I do agree with this as there are no ranged "good guys" except for the useless snow golem. Cool idea! Also the fact that Minecraft Legends has cool golems that they won't add because it's in Legends is not fair, they are completely different games. Please mojang add more golems.

This would be amazing and make me so happy. Tasmanian devils are so endangered and bringing recognition to them would be such a great cause. They are my absolute favorite animal and far too few people even know they exist.
The Savannah biome definitely needs something, and Termite mounds sound interesting. It would add a new structure, and a new mob, to an otherwise dull and lifeless biome.
I really like this idea! It can add more life to the ocean and can be another way to make Turtles grow!

Sneak Creep enchantment allows players lower the detection range of nearby hostile mobs when sneaking.  From Sneak Creep I blocking mob detection 1 block away to Sneak Creep II blocking mob detection 4 blocks away (workâ€™s almost like the shelf block adding up per armor piece to a max of 16 blocks away). It also hides your armor when combined with invisibility potion. Creep sneak potion can be created using a mundane potion with a creeper leg.Sneak Creep potion stops already pursuing mobs from attacking you 8 to 16 blocks away depending on the strength of potion temporarily making them ignore you when sneaking until hit. When player stops sneaking it send a non-lethal explosion causing knockback equivalent to the strength of the potion. When in combination with the invisibility potion and the Creep Sneak enchantment mobs can temporarily be hit with out attacking or pursuing you whilst sneaking.
